Package ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit

Class EditorConfiguration

java.lang.Object
ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.EditorConfiguration
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable
public final class EditorConfiguration extends Object implements Cloneable
Stores configuration options for editors. Instances of this class can be used to:
  • reuse the same configuration for multiple editors
  • change the default configuration used by new editors
  • save and restore custom configurations using a ConfigurationSerializer
Since:
3.0

    • styles

      public TokenStyle[] styles
      An array of styles to associate with each TokenType. To set the style for a particular token type, you can use code like the following: 
       config.styles[ TokenType.LITERAL1.ordinal() ] = tokenStyle

  • Constructor Details

    • EditorConfiguration

      public EditorConfiguration()
      Creates a new, empty configuration. Fields that take an object parameter will have a value of null. Other fields will take their initial value from the default configuration. Fields will a null value are ignored when a configuration is applied.
      See Also:
      getDefaultConfiguration()

    • EditorConfiguration

      public EditorConfiguration​(JSourceCodeEditor ed)
      Creates a new configuration. The values of the configuration fields will be copied from the specified editor.
      Parameters:
      ed - the editor to copy a configuration from

  • Method Details

    • serialize

      public void serialize​(ConfigurationSerializer ser)
      Write this configuration to a serializer.
      Parameters:
      ser - the serializer implementation to use

    • deserialize

      public void deserialize​(ConfigurationSerializer ser)
      Read this configuration from a serializer. Any fields that have serialized values will have their values replaced. Other fields will remain unmodified.
      Parameters:
      ser - the serializer implementation to use

    • apply

      public void apply​(JSourceCodeEditor ed)
      Applies the settings in this configuration to an existing editor. If you are creating a new editor, it is more efficient to use the constructor that takes a configuration as a parameter.
      Parameters:
      ed - the editor to apply these settings to

    • getDefaultConfiguration

      public static EditorConfiguration getDefaultConfiguration()
      Returns a copy of the default configuration for new editors. Since the returned value is a copy, changes will not affect the default configuration of new editors unless it is explicitly set as the default.
      Returns:
      a copy of the default configuration

    • setDefaultConfiguration

      public static void setDefaultConfiguration​(EditorConfiguration config)
      Sets the default configuration for new editors.
      Parameters:
      config - the default configuration to use for new editors

    • resetDefaultConfiguration

      public static void resetDefaultConfiguration()
      Resets the default configuration for new editors to the built-in default, replacing any default set with setDefaultConfiguration(ca.cgjennings.ui.textedit.EditorConfiguration).

    • clone

      public EditorConfiguration clone()
      Returns a new copy of this configuration.
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object
      Returns:
      a new configuration initialized with a copy of this configuration's values
